course.subject: CENG
course.name: Introduction to Environmental Engineering
course.description: Fundamentals of environmental impact assessment will be discussed. Life cycle analysis of carbon and energy will be introduced using case studies. Principles of environmental engineering for control of air, water, solid and noise pollution will be discussed, including global pollution, pollution prevention and minimization. Cost of available technologies will be analyzed.

reviews.author: Shivansh A
reviews.title: GOOD grade course if you are willing to put in some effort
reviews.comment_content:
I honestly don't know why I took this course but I don't regret it after I got my grade üòÅ. I thought environmental engineering concepts would be useful to know in this modern world where sustainability is promoted everywhere but turns out all that is bs and people always wanna save some $$. Anyways, this course is very surface level into environmental engineering and utilises some chemistry concepts. The main topics are:

1. General chemistry (pH, equilibrium, pKa, acids and alkali)
2. Units and Dimensions
3. Air pollution and its treatment devices
4. Mass balance (Probably the hardest topic)

MIDTERM

4. Wastewater (split into 3 parts --> Drinking water, river water and  wastewater engineering)
5. Solid waste (very briefly covered)

FiNAL
reviews.comment_teaching:
I would say Frank is one of the best professors I have had at UST so far. He is able to teach in a way that is both informative and funny, which keeps the class's attention from time to time. He also is very easy to contact after lecture hours with his email and office hours being convenient for students to access. He is also chill about grading and doesn't want this course to be too much pressure on the students so he'll even delay certain deadlines if he feels it is too tight.

Although he teaches in a nice way, the contents of the course itself are so dry that I sometimes lose my attention whilst he is talking.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite soft and it is not hard to score into the A range with some dedication.

There is

3 assignments (10%) : Mean is usually 100%, assignments are usually easy and you get at least 2 weeks to complete it

Presentation 15%) + Report (15%): Unreleased grade. This is honestly the most time consuming part of the course

Midterm (20%) - Mean : 39.32 My score: 42.5 (Mean was quite high that time)

Final (40%) - Grade not released

Final score: A+

I think if you can dedicate time on your presentation and report more than is required, it would make Frank happy and the grade you get will boost up compared to the rest. If you have decent presentation skills you will be far ahead of other groups for the presentation as Frank really values that when you are presenting. Otherwise, just be consistent with gaining your knowledge over the semester or else you will fall behind. I only had loose connection with each topic and just knew surface level stuff, so this course is good in that regard as it actually offers an introduction into the world of environmental engineering.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not too bad before midterm. Only content is taught and there is 1 assignment to do. The most time consuming part of this whole course is the presentation and report. If your group is good and hardworking it should be fine, but otherwise it can be very heavy workload. The report and presentation usually happens around the end of semester and it is not impossible to do. 1-2 weeks of focused work with your group should be enough to do a good job. The workload fluctuates for this course, with it being lighter before midterms and right before finals, but pretty heavy leading up to the presentation and report.

reviews.author: jasper487
reviews.title: Should take only if you are set on taking Environmental Engineering.
reviews.comment_content:
1) Fundamentals of Environmental Engineering
2) Units & Dimensions
3) Air Pollution
4) Environmental Chemistry
5) Water, Drinking Water, Wastewater Treatments
6) Solid Waste

- No attendance is taken
- Not required to study from any textbooks, powerpoints created and provided by the professor are enough.
- Lecture Videos are provided, and Frank is always willing to help.
reviews.comment_teaching: Frank is a really good lecturer compared to other course lecturers I have taken that semester. He knows when to ask questions and crack jokes to reel back students' concentration, and I think that's a really important skill that not many other lecturers have perfected. While he does tend to go fast at some times, he does recognize the picked-up pace and pauses the lecture momentarily to make sure everyone's on the same page, whilst answering and reviewing any questions or content asked by anyone. Furthermore, he always provides local examples of content talked about in lectures such as the Shing Mun Water Treatment Plant, which is helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
- Assignments (3 in total) -> 10%
- Midterm -> 20%
- Final -> 40%
- Group Project and Oral Presentation -> 30% (15% report + 15% presentation)

- Very lenient grading
- However, it is worth noting that the mean is very high, and getting high marks may be very difficult.
- Frank allows the use of cheat sheets(limited) in both the Midterm and the Final

Managed to get just above the mean(39/50) in Midterms, and an average of 90% in the assignments. Final and Project marks weren't released.

Final Grade: A
To be honest, I'll take it.
reviews.comment_workload: Large amounts of content are covered so quickly, and sometimes it Is hard to catch up. However, Frank is always willing to help, and that alleviates some of the stress. The immense workload all falls under the oral presentation and group project. This took way longer than expected for me and my groupmates, and honestly, this is why this course should be taken by those who wish to major in Environmental Engineering. I spent 2 whole days of my study break on this project. The research, report, and all the factors to consider took way too long. However, with perfect time management, it will be easy to score a high grade in this course.

reviews.author: KoreanNumber1
reviews.comment_content:
- Teaches the fundamental concepts of environmental engineering, including environmental chemistry, air pollution, water pollution, and solid waste
- Does not check attendance
- Tutorial section is optional
reviews.comment_teaching:
- LAM, Leung Yuk Frank is always willing to help students and answer any question
- Use PowerPoint slides
- No textbook
- Lecture videos are provided
- Tutorials give practice questions and are useful when studying for exam
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 10%, Midterm exam 20%, Project 30%, Final exam 40%
- 15% of the project is from the report, and other 15% is from the presentation (both has the group grade)
- Both midterm exam and final exam are open-notes

Midterm exam stats (out of 50)
Mean: 39.32
Min: 17
Q1: 33.88
Q2: 42
Q3: 46.63
Max: 50
reviews.comment_workload:
- There are total 3 homework to submit
- For the project, you choose a topic along with a group and produce a report and a presentation
- Each person in the group needs to write at least 5 pages for the report
- The presentation is 15 minutes long with 5 minutes of Q&A
- Over one month to work on the project, so better to start early

reviews.author: Anonymous784
reviews.title: Only take if you are passionate about Environmental Engineering
reviews.comment_content: I honestly took the course due to the lenient grading policy. Once I am actually enrolled though, getting a good grade is not as easy as all the reviews here make it seem. The PowerPoint presentations are a bit too superficial; the professor will usually annotate them quite heavily to convey a multitude of things that are not contained in the actual presentation. You may consult the textbook if you want more details, only to find out that the textbook is almost 1000 pages long, so long that its difficult to know where to even start. The professor does entertain questions in the lecture though, but my point is that studying independently is harder than it sounds.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is great; he is always able to slip in a joke or two in his lectures. He gives many real world examples about environmental engineering (e.g. wastewater treatment plants in Sha Tin, the 'Junk Bay', e.t.c.).
reviews.comment_grading:
Course Assessment
Homework assignment 10%
Mid-term exam 20%
Group project and oral presentation 30% (15% report + 15%
presentation)
Final exam 40%
reviews.comment_workload: The group project definitely takes up time; you need to coordinate with your groupmates about exactly which pollutant you want to talk about, the content to include, e.t.c.

reviews.author: K Knight
reviews.comment_content:
There are lots of reviews mentioned, but I am not going to repeat them.
Expect some chemistry (rates and equilibrium), physics(gas), and some common sense knowledge.
The schedule of the class is not quite in a rush.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Frank is a nice professor and his tone will not let you fall asleep despite the PowerPoint being long and boring.
the TA sucks at teaching tutorials so if you went to the tutorial and see the person teaching is not frank, just leave, but if you want guides on homework, better attend tutorials more often.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework assignment 10%
Mid-term exam 20%
Group project and oral presentation   30% (15% report + 15% presentation)
Final exam 40%
Managed to get a mean score in mid-term and about 90% in HW, Frank didn't release the score for the project and final.
Final letter grade: B+
quite loose grading TBH
reviews.comment_workload: light workload. assignment is not too difficult, but the project needs someone to carry it. just find some NDS students when grouping if you have no friends in this course with you.

reviews.author: Asta
reviews.title: very good grade course
reviews.comment_content: if you have study chemistry in high school then this course should be ok for you at the beginning. but as soon as it reaches to mid term, things will start to get hard and it is better to review the lesson notes after his classes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Frank is a really good and kind professor. He is willing to answer your questions after class. But sometimes his classes can quite boring.
reviews.comment_grading: the grading was so good. Best course grade. I didn't study well for the finals and didn't know how to do some of the questions, but still end up getting an A-. Most of the people get B+ or A- so if you work hard enough it will be quite easy to get an A range.
reviews.comment_workload: There is one group project, mid term, final and homework. Homework is quite easy and group project is not really demanding

reviews.author: YUpEp
reviews.title: Prep you cheatsheet well and you will get good grades
reviews.comment_content:
Severe types of pollutions are covered in this course like water pollution, air pollution, solid pollution, water treatment etc
A bit challenging for a year-1 student(myself) to study when studying the material balance(not taught in dse)
Some part of the tutorial notes is difficult to learn, but that's out-syl so no worry.
I got 4 assignments and 1 group pj in this course.
The group project is that, you have to choose a pollution topic, design a treatment mechanism for it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Frank teaches nicely but sometimes you will still get sleepy in class (there is only one time session which is 9-1030am, maybe becuz of that haha)
I attended the tutorial twice but I think it was not that useful. But Frank will teach how to do the assignments in the tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading:
You may prep 5 pages cheastsheet for the Midterm(cant remember clearly) and 6 pages for the final.
Just try to add all the formulas and some hard concepts inside as high prob to ask.
I prep a little for my MT and got 28/40, and the marks of final and group project arent announced. But I think the final is at acceptable difficulty if you prep cheatsheet well.

Homework assignment 10%
Mid-term exam 20%
Group project and oral presentation 30% (15% report + 15%
presentation)
Final exam 40%
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignments always take a lot of time to do as you have to go through your lec notes, understand, and try to apply on your notes. Recommend you to check and with your classmates, but you may also buy source (the assignments exactly the same in the past source.

You have to spend a lot of time to deal with your group project. The group project is that you have to choose a pollution topic, and design a treatment mechanism for it. Prepare the presentation slides and report also take your time.

reviews.comment_content:

reviews.comment_teaching: Frank is a nice guy. He is willing to answer all your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:

final grade : B

Quite big.
The project report requires each people to write at least 5 pages and lot of time is required to do the research. Better start it quickly if you are a deadline fighter.

4 Assignment in total. Handleable.

reviews.author: Ôºæ„ÉªÔªå„ÉªÔºæ
reviews.comment_content:
The content of this course, in my opinion, is quite difficult for an introductory course. Topics (like mass balance) need to be understood and practiced thoroughly to approach the exam questions.

The content includes:
1) Introduction
2) Units and mass balance
3) Environmental chemistry
4) Air pollution control
5) Water/ Wastewater treatment
6) Solid waste treatment
7) Waste-to-energy technology

A solid background in high school chemistry is definitely required.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Frank is quite nice and you can tell he is passionate about the subject. He is very approachable and is willing to answer doubts. He is also considerate of any issues students have such as time conflicts and problems with the online system.

However, the teaching itself tends to be a bit boring. I found the PPT to be rather disorganized. There are usually 60+ pages and it is difficult to separate the useful information from pages of statistics. And due to the scattered nature of the lecture notes, there is very little flow in the teaching. It can seem like you are jumping from one topic to another.

Attendance is not mandatory and there are not many people who attend the lecture. Many students prefer to self-study.

There are two TAs who taught one tutorial each just to satisfy their teaching requirement. The rest of the tutorials are all taken by Frank.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading scheme:
-----------------------------------------------------
Homework - 10%
Mid-term examination - 20%
Group project and presentation - 30%
Final examination - 40%
-----------------------------------------------------
HOMEWORK

The homework assignments had a mix of easy and difficult questions. Similar questions can be found in the notes and textbook. There were a total of 4 assignments but the last one was scrapped due to time constraints.

EXAMS

The exams, similar to the homework, also consist of a mixture of simple and tricky questions.
You are allowed one A4 sized cheatsheet (2 sides) for the midterm and 2 sheets (4 sides) for the final.
The marks of the final exam were not released.

GROUP PROJECT
The group project is quite important and can help you bounce back if you performed below average in the midterm. If you do the research thoroughly and have a well presented project, I believe it is relatively easy to get a good grade.
---------------------------------------------------
Overall, despite having only a very loose understanding of a lot of the topics, I still got a pretty decent grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
I found the workload to be high for an introductory/common core course.

The group project involves selecting a type of waste from a list given by Frank and then coming up with a way to treat this waste. You need to prepare both a presentation and a report. The presentation should be about 30 mins long (5 mins per person + 10 mins Q&A). The main areas covered in the report should be 1. abstract and introduction, 2. treatment methodology, 3. advanced treatment process, 4. cost evaluation and comparison and 5. key highlights. Naturally, the project, if done properly, requires time and effort. However, I think it is easily manageable with proper planning.

What I found more time consuming were the assignments and studying to actually understand the content. A lot of it was complex and took a lot of practice to grasp. Being a required course for Chemical & Environmental Engineering  majors, a large portion of the class is comprised of year 4s. Many of the concepts covered, they have already learned so it is tougher as a year 1 to catch up to the rest of the class.

reviews.author: Duppy Conqueror
reviews.title: A fairly good CC course
reviews.comment_content:
Content is good, but quite heavy for a CC course
1. Units and Mass Balance
2. Environmental Chemistry
3. Air Pollution and Control
4. Water Pollution and Wastewater Treatment
5. Solid Waste and its Treatment
6. Life-Cycle Assessment (Out of syllabus this semester)
(No wonder why this course has no waitlist)

You are recommended to have chemistry background for taking this course. (Even the professor said that)
As it covers mass balance, expect some calculations.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Frank is a nice person. He is willing to answer questions from the students. However, the lecture is a bit boring due to the heavy content.
Frank expects some students to appear only in the first lecture, midterm exam, review lecture, presentation and final exam.
Skipping lectures isn't a problem but make sure to read those 60+ pages of lecture notes after that
reviews.comment_grading:
ACCORDING TO THE COURSE ASSESSMENT:
Homework Assignment 10%
Midterm Exam 20%
Group Project and Oral Presentation 30%
Final Exam 40%

Both exams are closed-book.
1 cheat sheet is allowed in the midterm exam.
2 cheat sheets are allowed in the final exam.
Contents can be written on both sides of the cheat sheets.
Make sure to write every point and equation into your sheets!

Group project and final exam results are not released.
Transparency is questionable.
Hard to tell if it is good-grading

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignment: Light
4 assignments as designed
3 assignments only this semester
Most of them are calculations. Plug the correct formula and equations and you are good.

Group project: Medium to heavy

- Form a group of 4 (Good luck on that)
- 30 mins (5 min./student + 10 min. Q&A)
- Choose a waste from the list Frank has given (Make sure to choose an easy waste)
- Identify the information, possible source, spreading pathways of the waste
- Design a treatment process for the waste
- Describe the discharging process, technology and devices involved

A lot of research is required

reviews.title: Nice

He is a passionate in his teaching.+1

reviews.comment_teaching: He is a passionate in his teaching. Even though there is example for the calculation, he will still demonstrate the step once more. He always gives further examples to explain which are not included in slides.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework assignment (10%)
Mid-term exam (20%)
Group project and oral presentation (30%)
Final exam (40%)

In mid-term exam, one cheat sheet is allowed.
In final exam, two cheat sheet is allowed.

Grading is nice. However, there is no grading for final exam and the group project.
reviews.comment_workload: Huge workload for both assignment and group project. The assignments require lot of time to finish.

reviews.author: Jintong
reviews.title: Great introduction to some waste/pollution treatment
reviews.comment_content: Environmental chemistry, mass balance, air, water, solid waste treatment
reviews.comment_teaching: Frank likes to joke and give us a good laugh. He is responsible and genuine. The content is quite a bit, you may need to review every week and read his ppt ahead. Sometimes the treatment process could be boring, but he will leave his lecture note on canvas so you could always go back to have a look.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 assignments, a mid-term, a team presentation and final.
To get a good grade, you may want to discuss assignment with class mates and check each others' work, so you don't make careless mistake.
The mid-term wasn't too hard but he will give a trick question and most of us didn't know how to do it. He will allow a piece of A4 cheat sheet.
If you only got a average for mid-term, please do well for the team presentation, my group did quite a bit of research so he and the TAs were satisfied, and I guess we got a good grade.
The final he will allow 2 pieces of A4 cheat sheet, so don't throw away your previous sheet. It wasn't too hard, but will include more concept question. You can review this from the PPTs.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignments get harder as we progress in the course. So do not expect to finish it right away. They took me quite some time.
To do well for presentation, you need to research throughly. Please take some time.
The workload is heavier than most of my courses, e.g. 1902 LIFS.

2.Units and mass balance

reviews.comment_teaching: The content is rich, and it is interesting when the professor talks about some principles and facts. But there are a lot of calculation involved in the course, it becomes difficult to understand when the professor talk about it. You need to learn by yourself.

I think it is OK.
If you understand the PPT, homework is easy to finish.  
There will be four people working on a project and each person speaks for about five minutes. And professor may ask a few questions.
You should prepare your own cheat sheet. The more information, the better. You will need them when you take exams.

reviews.author: Mgenie
reviews.title: nice person but okay professor
reviews.comment_content:
His slides are so content-heavy. He always has 60-70 pages and there is so much to memorize.

You are allowed to have an A4 cheatsheet during the mid-term and final but you will end up not using it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a funny guy and a nice person. He promised to buy a pizza.

Besides his personality, he is a professor who is just so passionate about his major, which is environmental engineering. So even when he prepared 60-70 pages of slides, he always gives additional explanations even when it is not included in the curriculum. It is good that you get to know more about environmental engineering, but it becomes so hard to differentiate which one was part of the course and which one was not when it comes to mid-term and final.
reviews.comment_grading: Despite the heavy workload, his grading was good. But he doesn't show what grade we got for finals and the group project.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was heavy because we have 20 minutes long presentation along with 20 pages of a report, while we have a mid-term, final, and four assignments.

reviews.author: ynag
reviews.comment_content:
‚Ä¢ Introduction
‚Ä¢ Units & Mass Balance
‚Ä¢ Environmental Chemistry
‚Ä¢ Air Pollution Control
‚Ä¢ Wastewater Treatment
‚Ä¢ Solid Waste Treatment
‚Ä¢ Waste-to-energy Technology

The content of the course is interesting for those who are interested in environmental engineering but have little to no background in it. It covers the general material from various different topics which I found to be a good introduction to the field.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof is very good at explaining the topics and you can see that he is passionate in the subject. He also likes to include several experiences and would lighten the mood with some jokes if he sees that students are getting bored. However, due to time limit, the later parts of the lectures (towards the end of the term) were covered a bit too quickly/ skipped over. Overall though, his teaching is good and would recommend him.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework Assignment 10%
Mid Term Exam 20%
Group Project & Oral Presentation 30%
Final Exam 40%

The grades for the final exam and group project were not released but aside from that, the grading was generally transparent. You get approximately what you expect.
reviews.comment_workload: A bit high for a common core course, especially as the professor likes to cover a wide range of topics throughout the term and the fact that there is a group project as well. However, it is manageable as long as you start early.

reviews.author: soso_1414
reviews.comment_content:
Content is quite heavy in terms of a 3-credit course
Majorly environmental stuff.
Divided into:

reviews.comment_teaching:
Even though online classes were going on teaching was ok. Professor Frank is quite a jovial soul and understands students SOMETIMES :).Answers emails really quick.
TA was also very helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments are easy to score if you have paid attention in class.
Mid-term is also ok
Finals are so so as well.
Grading has not been released so far.
reviews.comment_workload:
HEAVY WORKLOAD!!!!!!
4 assignments
1 midterm
1 final
1 group project+presentation

reviews.author: aiikooo
reviews.comment_content:
Content is ok. Learned about environmental issues basically. No chemistry knowledge is needed but you will definitely struggle if you don't have a chemistry background.

3 quizzes but they will choose your 2 best scores. Consists of multiple choice, essay and problem solving (calculations)
Class participation in lectures.
Group homework (I forgot if there's 2 or 3 of them) and case studies (included in the homework)

Took this course in my first yr and I think there are a lot of year 3/ year 4 students taking the class so it's hard to find fellow first years
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring lectures but he sometimes shows ted talks or videos that are more interesting. Monotonous voice. Most of the students prefer sitting at the back of the class
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is ok. Dunno what happened to my assignments and how they graded it but my assignment scores were around mean.
High mean for quizzes but they chose the 2 best scores so I guess that gives u a second chance if you mess up with one of them
reviews.comment_workload: 2 or 3 group homework (I forgot). Groups of three. The format of the homework varies. There are calculations, analysis, and case studies.

reviews.author: ShayA
reviews.title: Avoid this course if possible
reviews.comment_content:
1) Units and measurements
2) Fate and transport
3)Engineering Decisions
4) Water purification
5) Air pollution and treatment
6) Human Factor
7) Sun and water

To be honest, I don't know where the course was going with these topics. The delivery and teaching was so bad that all these concepts seem half-assed. But if I was to be objective, I'd say the content is decent for the average engineering major. It covers a good range of scientific concepts and engineering concepts including some techniques in decision making. However, for people with no chemistry background, the course seems like a nightmare because (at least in some chapters) you need high school level chemistry to attempt the questions. The course seemed to overload on too many of these concepts. For instance, the lecture on fate and transport included too many physical and chemical properties with no time given to individual ones. At other times, the content was too easy to even bother listening. AVOID THIS COURSE IF YOU ARE NOT A PERSON WITH A CHEMISTRY BACKGROUND. The last few chapters were absolute garbage and I learned absolutely nothing from them. If you are a senior in CENG, then this course is an easy A content wise.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Probably the worse teacher I have had yet in UST. Not only is his delivery of the course monotonous and boring, he barely makes an effort to get some continuation into the concepts. It honestly feels like he jumps from one chapter to the next without you even realizing. He spends too much time playing videos and reads out the ppt for the rest of the time. The bits of information he adds are absolutely useless. The worked examples he does in class barely help you do the questions yourself. He BARELY HAS A GRASP ON ASSESSMENT. The students are clueless on what exactly is expected from the assessment and what techniques are required. The resources he adds are barely useful but are flooded with useless articles.

The TAs are decent and will go through different practice problems step by step. Although they seem clueless for most of the time as well, they are way better than the professor.
reviews.comment_grading:
DO NOT BELIEVE THE GRADING IN THE SYLLABUS.

This course has a history of not following through on the agreed upon grading methods.

The breakdown should be:
Class participation (15%)
Examinations (50%)
Case Study (15%)
Assignments (20%)

There were three exams and the best two were chosen. However, the difficulty level was extremely varied and the 2nd exam was way easier than the rest. The mean is very high but since we don't the grade boundaries, I cant tell if that matters.

There were supposed to be three assignments but there were only 2. The format is odd and we barely have any idea on how to attempt. The mean is still oddly high. I do not know what happened to the case study or the class participation (we were to write answers on pieces of paper in class).

Mean overall is high so if this course is curved, the grading is screwed up because you are competing against 3rd and 4th year engineering majors.

My breakdown:
Exams:
   1) 70/100 (mean 71.9)
   2) 100/100 (mean 77.9)
   3)  90/100 (mean 83.7)
     last two chosen
Assignments:
   1) 81.5/100 (mean 83.7)
   2) 100/100 (mean 81.3)
Class participation (No idea but probably high because I attended most classes)
Case study (No idea what happened to that)

Ended up with an A but I don't know how so yeah
reviews.comment_workload:
Basic workload. Exams are open book so you barely need to study and because there aren't many practice questions, you basically only go through the slides. The assignments are a day or two of work at best.

The annoying part is coming to classes for the class participation marks

reviews.title: Boring and useless course but low workload
reviews.comment_content:
It was supposed to have this syllabus
Week Topic
1 Identifying and Solving Environmental Problems
2 Engineering Decisions
3-4 Engineering Calculations
5 Basic Material Balances Environmental Applications
6 Water Quality
7-9 Water and Wastewater Treatments
10 Air Quality
11 Air Pollution Control
12 Human Factors
13 Ethics of Green Engineering
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures are very boring but you have to attend as there is participation mark (attendance)
Always spending time in searching relevant videos on Youtube and fixing problems about the audio
reviews.comment_grading: Normal grading, get what expected
reviews.comment_workload:
Class Participation (Attendance): 15 %
Assignments (x2, suppose 3): 20 %
Case Study Project (maybe in the assignment???): 15 %
Examinations: 50 % (Three exams will be given during the semester. Only two exams will be counted towards grade.)

All exams are open notes, quite easy

reviews.author: ohikuy
reviews.title: quite good
reviews.comment_content:
Week Topics
1 Identifying and Solving Environmental Problems
2 Engineering Decisions
3-4 Engineering Calculations
5 Basic Material Balances
7 Midterm Examination(Late March)
7 Water Quality
10-11 Water and Wastewater Treatments
12 Air Quality

14 Ethics of Green Engineering

reviews.comment_teaching:
a bit boring because of his tone
lots of videos and examples given during lectures
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade Assessment:
Class Participation5 %
Assignments20%
Case Study15%
Midterm Examination30%
Final Examination30%

grade:
A1: unknown
A2: unknown
MT: 100/100
Final: 68/100
Final grade: A-

there should be a case study as a group project, but it seemed that he forgot or something, so there was an assignment 2 handed in during final exam.

class participation: he asked us to solve some problems every lecture, and hand in at the end. not sure about if tutorial counts cuz i skipped almost all of them.

all open book exam and assignments were given ahead of time.
reviews.comment_workload:
quit light

exams are open book, just print all the lectures and materials and you r good to go.

Assignment: follow the notes and use common sense to solve the problems. correct calculation and decent reasoning will be fine

reviews.author: Pranjal Mathur
reviews.comment_content:
This course is a basic introduction to environmental engineering and covers the following:

Being an Environmental Engineer
- Identifying and Solving Environmental Problems
- Engineering Decisions
-Engineering Calculations
-Basic Material Balances

Environmental Applications
-Water Quality
-Water and Wastewater Treatments
-Air Quality
-Air Pollution Control
-Human Factors
-Ethics of Green Engineering

Most of the content is covered through Lectures and tutorials.
There are also additional reading materials for each chapter.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This professor has a very slight interest in the engagement of the class and hence does not put in a full effort into his teaching. The lectures are neither engaging nor informative.

The reading material is very general and does not work parallel to the teaching. The only real benefit of attending the classes is the class participation points. The content of the course must be covered through self study.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course grade is SUPPOSED to be divided as such:

Class Participation-5%
Assignments-20%(4 case studies across the semester)
Case Study-15%
Midterm Examination-30%
Final Examination-30%

There were only 2 assignments which had been rushed across the end of the semester. There was no case study ever declared or even discussed.

Class Participation: Attendance of classes and tutorials regularly should be enough.

Midterm examination: Calculation based examination which tested the first half of the syllabus. The mean for the exam was 80/100.

Final exam: Calculation based examination which tested the second half of the syllabus. No marks were declared.

Assignment 1: A midterm styled assignment where literature values required for calculations had to be mined for individually. There was also a 500 word essay regarding a

Assignment 2: Reaction paper to a set of YouTube videos regarding over-fishing of many seas across the world. Submitted on the day of the final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Fairly light. Studying for the midterm and final should be sufficed if there is enough preparation with respect to the calculations as they are the most scoring part.

reviews.author: ARK
reviews.title: Short Review Summary
reviews.comment_content: Content is useful to increase your general knowledge because it is a common core course. The course covers air, water, land pollution, materials balance and environmental chemistry. No previous knowledge is needed, but pay attention to the lecture notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Frank is very nice, but lecture is very boring. You don't need to go into any lecture you can just study by reading all the lecture notes in canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading, mean+1SD on the midterms, never did the homework seriously, but Frank did not release the grades of the finals and group project. Final grade is A-
10% 4 sets of homework, 20% midterms, 30% project, 40% finals
reviews.comment_workload: Group project needs a lot of work, workload of studying for midterms and finals is okay, and the homework can be easy if you know where to look. But overall the workload is more than I would have wanted.

reviews.author: ls
reviews.title: Short Review Summary
reviews.comment_content:
1. Environmental chemistry
2. Material balance
3. Air pollution
4. (Waste)Water treatment
5. Solid waste treatment
reviews.comment_teaching: the professor is fun, quite funny, but his notes are boring as well as his teaching, you are allowed to use 1 A4 paper for cheatsheet
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework assignment 10%
Mid-term exam 20%
Group project and oral presentation 30%
Final exam 40%

Homeworks are quite easy if you listened, because all the answers are basically in the notes, and sometimes he could give the solutions if the whole class don't understand the question.

I got an A-, mid term exam Mean + almost 1 SD, he didn't announce the score for group project and final.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is quite a lot, there are an estimate of 18-19 lecture notes.

20 pages for report and 20 minutes of presentation.

reviews.author: Leung Ka Chung
reviews.comment_content:
1. Environmental chemistry
2. Material balance
3. Air pollution
4. (Waste)Water treatment
5. Solid waste treatment
Although the course have no pre-requisite, it require a lot of knowledge on chemistry and it would be a tough time if you have no chemistry background.
reviews.comment_teaching: Frank is nice but his lecture is boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework assignment 10%
Mid-term exam 20%
Group project and oral presentation 30%
Final exam 40%
As professor didn't release the result of group project and final exam, it is hard to comment on grading but i got a C even i have put much effort.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy. There are four assignment and each of them takes much time to finish. For the group project,  we form a group of 5 and have to finish a 20-page report and do a presentation around 20 min. Frank give us a list of waste and each group will choose one to figure out how to treat them appropriately.
